messages.message:
Hey, I just tried out the new app runs and converse APIs (via Postman). Way easier to use and more intuitive than the old ones :raised_hands: Some things I found though:
1. [Converse] 'List Conversations' returns every conversation in the org. Is this expected? I would've thought it should return my user's conversations within the org only, not sure if there are privacy/security concerns here? 
2. [Converse] 'Ask a Question' doesn't produce a matching question in the UI. I just found this surprising since when creating a convo, uploading docs etc you can see the matching result in the UI
3. [Converse] 'Add Documents' doesn't have a polling call. If uploading many documents, there is no way of knowing when the docs have appeared in the conversation before you begin asking questions (as far as I can tell)
4. [App Run] 'Run App' in the Body, I believe "name" -> "app_name". IB-Context header was also missing. I then got the error below which I haven't been able to resolve
@Anil @Lee
1 Is a security issue I reported, they are working on fixing it

1. Issue with list conversations will be fixed in the upcoming release (24.16). @daniel please chime in.
2. 'Ask a Question' - won't persist the response from the model. With the Converse app, there is an internal API to persist the responses.
3. You can use get_conversation to get the status of the documents uploaded. This pattern is similar to create conversation
Adding @Anil for the 'Run App' API changes

A few questions Hamish to debug the run apps:
• Is the input batch stored in a workspace in the organization? Wondering whether this was accidentally stored in your personal workspace?
• Do you have access to the app in the organization?
Thanks @hannah! It was the first, no IB-Context header so batch wasn't in my organisation workspace
Glad it worked out! Feedback taken though on it defaulting to community context without realizing it.
Thank you for catching the bugs :slightly_smiling_face: Updated. Note that these reference the new APIs and are not public yet. Will go live with 24.16.
